topic: AI Research and Publications in 2024

  entities:
    Merlyn.org|Organization
    Ahmed M Abuzuraiq|Person
    Philippe Pasquier|Person
    Tessa Han|Person

    Mohammed Salah|Person

    Peng Xia|Person

    California|Location

    Wenxuan Zhang|Person

  proposition: Merlyn.org developed first-ever education-specific language models for trustworthy generative AI in education.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Merlyn.org|DEVELOPED|education-specific language models
    Merlyn.org|FOCUS|trustworthy generative AI in education

  proposition: Ahmed M Abuzuraiq and Philippe Pasquier explored personalizing generative AI with small data for visual arts co-creation.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Ahmed M Abuzuraiq|RESEARCHED|personalizing generative AI
    Philippe Pasquier|RESEARCHED|personalizing generative AI
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    Ahmed M Abuzuraiq|COLLABORATED_WITH|Philippe Pasquier

  proposition: Tessa Han and colleagues investigated approaches towards safe large language models for medicine.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Tessa Han|RESEARCHED|safe large language models for medicine

  proposition: Cheng Peng et al. conducted a study on generative large language models for medical research and healthcare.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Cheng Peng|RESEARCHED|generative large language models
    Cheng Peng|FOCUS|medical research and healthcare

  proposition: Yiqiao Jin et al. created AgentReview to explore peer review dynamics using LLM agents.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Yiqiao Jin|CREATED|AgentReview
    AgentReview|PURPOSE|explore peer review dynamics

  proposition: Mohammed Salah et al. examined the potential of generative AI for social psychology research.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Mohammed Salah|RESEARCHED|generative AI
    Mohammed Salah|FOCUS|social psychology research

  proposition: Andy K Zhang et al. developed Cybench, a framework for evaluating cybersecurity capabilities and risks of language models.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Andy K Zhang|DEVELOPED|Cybench
    Cybench|PURPOSE|evaluating cybersecurity capabilities and risks of language models

  proposition: Yusuf Roohani et al. created BioDiscoveryAgent, an AI agent for designing genetic perturbation experiments.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Yusuf Roohani|CREATED|BioDiscoveryAgent
    BioDiscoveryAgent|PURPOSE|designing genetic perturbation experiments

  proposition: Deloitte advocated for evolving AI governance from static to dynamic approaches.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Deloitte|ADVOCATED|evolving AI governance
    Deloitte|PROPOSED|dynamic approaches to AI governance

  proposition: WTW emphasized the need for dynamic AI governance to seize opportunities and manage risks.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    WTW|EMPHASIZED|need for dynamic AI governance
    WTW|FOCUS|seizing opportunities and managing risks

  proposition: Han Bao et al. investigated whether large vision-language models can benchmark themselves.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Han Bao|RESEARCHED|large vision-language models self-benchmarking

  proposition: Lizhou Fan et al. developed NPHardEval4V, a dynamic reasoning benchmark for multimodal large language models.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Lizhou Fan|DEVELOPED|NPHardEval4V
    NPHardEval4V|PURPOSE|dynamic reasoning benchmark for multimodal large language models

  proposition: Eldar Kurtic et al. created Mathador-LM, a dynamic benchmark for mathematical reasoning on large language models.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Eldar Kurtic|CREATED|Mathador-LM
    Mathador-LM|PURPOSE|dynamic benchmark for mathematical reasoning

  proposition: Peng Xia et al. developed CARES, a comprehensive benchmark of trustworthiness in medical vision language models.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Peng Xia|DEVELOPED|CARES
    CARES|PURPOSE|comprehensive benchmark of trustworthiness in medical vision language models

  proposition: California introduced Senate Bill No. 1047 (Safe and Secure Innovation for Frontier Artificial Intelligence Models Act).
    entity-attribute relationships:
    California|INTRODUCED|Senate Bill No. 1047
    Senate Bill No. 1047|PURPOSE|Safe and Secure Innovation for Frontier Artificial Intelligence Models

  proposition: California Chamber of Commerce reported that the 'Godmother of AI' warned SB 1047 AI bill could restrict innovation.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    California Chamber of Commerce|REPORTED|warning about SB 1047
    SB 1047|POTENTIAL_IMPACT|restrict innovation

  proposition: Wenxuan Zhang et al. proposed Bi-Factorial Preference Optimization to balance safety and helpfulness in language models.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Wenxuan Zhang|PROPOSED|Bi-Factorial Preference Optimization
    Bi-Factorial Preference Optimization|PURPOSE|balance safety and helpfulness in language models

topic: AI Governance and Regulation

  entities:
    California|Location
    Senate Bill No. 1047|Regulation
    California Chamber of Commerce|Organization
    Deloitte|Organization
    WTW|Organization

  proposition: Deloitte advocated for evolving AI governance from static to dynamic approaches.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Deloitte|ADVOCATED|evolving AI governance
    Deloitte|PROPOSED|dynamic approaches to AI governance

  proposition: WTW emphasized the need for dynamic AI governance to seize opportunities and manage risks.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    WTW|EMPHASIZED|need for dynamic AI governance
    WTW|FOCUS|seizing opportunities and managing risks

  proposition: California introduced Senate Bill No. 1047 (Safe and Secure Innovation for Frontier Artificial Intelligence Models Act).
    entity-attribute relationships:
    California|INTRODUCED|Senate Bill No. 1047
    Senate Bill No. 1047|PURPOSE|Safe and Secure Innovation for Frontier Artificial Intelligence Models

  proposition: California Chamber of Commerce reported that the 'Godmother of AI' warned SB 1047 AI bill could restrict innovation.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    California Chamber of Commerce|REPORTED|warning about SB 1047
    SB 1047|POTENTIAL_IMPACT|restrict innovation
